jobDescription: Description:Providence is calling a Clinical Data Analyst to Providence Health & Services in Seattle, WA. The Clinical Data Analyst is responsible for assistance in collecting, analyzing, graphing and reporting data generated from clinical information systems. Analysis includes acute care, non-acute care, ambulatory, physician clinic, health plan data, and other areas of the continuum of care. In this position you will:Have responsibility for System wide reports from the ministry level, to the Board of Directors.Assist with planning, defining and testing new measures, development and documentation of data or automation collection processes, validate data accuracy, and improvement of data collections.Collect and summarize clinical data; report results using SQL, spreadsheets, statistical programs, or other reporting software.Work with Business Intelligence Analyst in developing SQL queries and automating reports.Work in collaboration with the System Director and System Manager, Clinical Analytics in data collection and reporting methodologies. Prepare documentation on data collection and reporting processes.Develop quality checks to ensure data accuracy and integrity.Qualifications:Required qualifications for this position include:Minimum of a BA/BS degree in Health Information Management, Computer Science, Business Administration, Finance, or a related discipline.Minimum of three years of relevant data management, data analysis, or quality improvement experience in an acute care or clinical setting.About the department you will serve. Providence Strategic and Management Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for all eight regions of Providence Health & Services from Alaska to California. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise. We offer a full comprehensive range of benefits - see our website for details http://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/ Our Mission As people of Providence, we reveal God's love for all, especially the poor and vulnerable, through our compassionate service. About Us Providence Health & Services is the third largest not-for-profit health system in the United States. Providence employs more than 82,000 caregivers (employees) across a five-state area; AK, WA, MT, OR, and CA. Our facilities include 34 hospitals, 600 physician clinics, senior services, supportive housing and other health and educational services. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Category: Information Technology Location: Washington-Seattle Req ID: 179604
